commitResults.messageBody: Added user details to the template AboutUs page.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add a class to represent academic courses
Add functionality to 'find' to allow searching for substrings and ID numbers
Add functionality to search for Course names

commitResults.messageBody:
Create necessary classes in order to obey hierarchal OOP structure
already implemented in code.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add grade functionality to PersonList and 'add' command
Made it so that grade can be edited, not added to better match actual TA behaviour
Added JavaDoc comments to Model class for sort

commitResults.messageBody:
Course placeholder satisfies new regex. 

No major functionality changes.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add test classes for sort functionality and modify existing classes where necessary
Edit the Sort command to take in four different parameters (one at a time)
commitResults.messageBody:
Modify the SortParser class in accordance with the changes to the Sort
command class.

Create the helper SortDescriptor class and corresponding test class.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update the BetterModelClass UML to reflect the changes made to AB3
Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/ZaydM18/tp into E-ModelUML
Edit 'sort' command syntax to match other commands better
commitResults.messageBody:
Introduces the CLI syntax '/by' followed by the required sort field.

Updates SortCommandParser and SortCommandParser accordingly.

commitResults.messageTitle: Updated the User Guide to include references to the 'sort' command
Update the messaging of the find command to better reflect the actual model

commitResults.messageBody: Update ClearCommand to show the error message

commitResults.messageTitle: Update optional parameter example in UG
Fix DeleteSequence and Model class UML diagrams

commitResults.messageBody:
AboutUs contains information about non-relevant authors.

The AboutUs should contain information about ourselves.

Let's update the AboutUs with my info.

This defines a set template for the AboutUs.
Add Fai Yew's details in documentation

Developer Guide is outdated.

Outdated information can lead to inaccurate details.

Let's update Developer Guide.

This will standardise the format of the Developer Guide.

AboutUs.md does not follow the format expected from the tp.

This prevents the script from marking it as complete.

Let's:
* change all pictures to png files
* add [homepage] to follow the requested format

This way, our AboutUs.md will follow the specified format.

There is insufficient use cases to describe all the must-have
features in BetterCallTA.

Use cases help us have a general idea of how the operation should
flow.

Let's create use cases for all features with high priority.

Since we want to focus on the essentials first, creating use cases
only for those with high priority allows us to ensure these
must-haves are implemented properly before moving on.

There is no way to add extra information about a contact.

We may want to add vital information that cannot be easily
classified.

Let's add a Remark command.

This way, users can add general notes to their contacts.
Add a class to represent academic courses

commitResults.messageTitle: Add extra prefixes that will be used in later features
commitResults.messageBody:
Some arguments that we would like to use in later features do not
have prefixes.

Assigning a prefix to each of these arguments allow a standardized
way of indicating these parameters in the commands.

Let's:
* Assign a prefix to each new parameter in CLI syntax.
* Modify some comments in other classes to use "BetterCallTA" instead
of "address book"

By having an idea of the parameters that we will use for future
features, we can write our code in a way that allows easy integration
of new arguments.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add additional parameters to be used in future features
commitResults.messageBody:
There are no classes for the additional parameters that will be used.

Creating a class for each of the new parameters allows individual
initialisation and validation, decoupling these classes.

Let's
* Add new classes for the new parameters
* Modify comments in other Model classes to use "BetterCallTA" instead
of "address book"

Decoupling these classes allow them to be easily used and tested
without having to consider dependencies.
Update ArgumentTokenizer to handle '/option arg1' instead of 'option/â€¦

Edit command is incorrect as it does not use the new parameters
to be used for Student.

As such, the class cannot be compiled.

Let's modify Edit command to handle the correct parameters.

The program cannot build.

As such, we cannot test it manually to check for desired outputs.

Let's comment out test functions temporarily.
Fix ArgumentMultimap, ArgumentTokenizer to parse Add command

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/AY2425S2-CS2103T-T10-3/ tp into e-RefactorEverythingOhMy # Please enter a commit message to explain why this merge is # necessary, especially if it merges an updated upstream into a # topic branch. # # Lines starting with '#' will be ignored, and an empty message # aborts the commit.

commitResults.messageBody:
The fxml files are not updated with the new parameters to be used.

This caused the display of Person to fail, as the fxml files did
not reflect the changes in PersonCard.

Let's:
* add studentID label
* add course label

The studentId label is added to the left of the name, separated by
a dash. It is done this way as the student ID is the unique
identifier of students, and names should not be the unique
identifier in case of duplicate names among students.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add test cases for new Person properties
commitResults.messageBody:
Added test cases for the following Person properties:
* Attendance
* Course
* Id
* Participation
* Grade
* Note

commitResults.messageTitle: Add extra Person properties to relevant functions
commitResults.messageBody:
Several functions related to Person are outdated.

Since we are not using address and tags, these functions will
not work as intended.

Let's
* remove all instances of Address and Tag
* replace these instances with Attendance, Participation, Grade
and Note

This way, these functions will work with the new Person
properties that we will use.
E modify with functions creating Person class with new properties

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix incorrect response of Edit Command
commitResults.messageBody:
The command did not work for edits that changed other properties
except ID.

This does not follow the intended purpose of the command.

Let's ensure the Edit Command can work with ID, Name, Phone, Email
and Course from the Person properties.

The other Person properties are non-essential, and will be included
in another command after the MVP version.

This reverts commit 5c9aca07d37c05da9979f0b8511e2cae2d8b22ca, reversing
changes made to 6938fb6377e8c433d3765567f3a61b97d852f1c2.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add test cases for extra Person parameters and fix other test cases
Change output message of Edit Command
commitResults.messageBody:
The output message contains details for properties that were
not changed.

Aside from Id, other properties that were not changed are redundant.
These would only clutter up the output message.

Let's update the output of the Edit command to only show the
(original) Id of the person edited and the respective properties
that have been changed.

This way, the output message becomes more concise and relevant. The
Id is included to identify the person that has been edited.

The test functions are outdated.

Test functions should be kept updated as frequent as possible to
prevent bugs from not being discovered.

Let's:
* Update test functions in EditCommandTest
* Modify code in other functions to suit their intended purposes,
as highlighted by the test functions

Test classes should be kept up-to-date.

The test functions are outdated.

Test functions should be kept updated as frequent as possible to
prevent bugs from not being discovered.

Let's:
* Update test functions in EditCommandParserTest
* Modify code in other functions to suit their intended purposes,
as highlighted by the test functions

Test classes should be kept up-to-date.

The test functions are outdated.

Test functions should be kept updated as frequent as possible to
prevent bugs from not being discovered.

Let's update test functions in GradeTest.

Test classes should be kept up-to-date.
Add functionality to search for Course names

The test functions are outdated.

Test functions should be kept updated as frequent as possible to
prevent bugs from not being discovered.

Let's:
* Update test functions in EditPersonDescriptorTest
* Modify code in other functions to suit their intended purposes,
as highlighted by the test functions

Test classes should be kept up-to-date.

The test functions are outdated.

Test functions should be kept updated as frequent as possible to
prevent bugs from not being discovered.

Let's update test functions in UniquePersonListTest.

Test classes should be kept up-to-date.

The test functions are outdated.

Test functions should be kept updated as frequent as possible to
prevent bugs from not being discovered.

Let's:
* Update test functions in JsonSerializableAddressBookTest
* Modify code in other functions to suit their intended purposes,
as highlighted by the test functions

Test classes should be kept up-to-date.

Some parts of our code does not align with the JavaDoc style.

We should have a standardised style so that the code seems like
it is written by one cohesive group.

Let's resolve all problems found by Checkstyle.

Checkstyle follows the format described by the JavaDoc styles.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix Checkstyle errors in test classes
commitResults.messageBody:
Some parts of our code in test classes do not align with the
JavaDoc style.

We should have a standardised style so that the code seems like
it is written by one cohesive group.

Let's resolve all problems found by Checkstyle in our test classes.

Checkstyle follows the format described by the JavaDoc styles.

The test case parseCommand_edit in AddressBookParserTest was not
passing.

We should ensure every test case passes to ensure our programme works
properly.

Let's modify parseCommand_edit to accept the input that we have
designed.

This way, we won't use the outdated input format and use our recent
format instead.

commitResults.messageTitle: Checkstyle throws an error for assertionThrow format
commitResults.messageBody:
Checkstyle disallows '(' at the beginning of a line.

For assertionThrow, this should be allowed for the lambda expression.

Let's modify suppressions.xml to allow '(' at the beginning of a line
for assertionThrow only.

This way, Checkstyle.xml should ignore this for assertionThrow but not
for other functions.

A test case in LogicManagerTest now fails since we changed the
command format of the Delete command.

We should update the test case to reflect this change in format.

Let's update the test case to reflect this change.

This way, all test cases follow our intended command formats.

The format and examples used in the section on Edit command are
incorrect.

This will confuse the users as to the proper usage of the Edit command.

Let's:
* Update the format of Edit command
* Extract constraints on the format in a warning box
* Update examples

This will allow the user to quickly scan through the points they need,
whether it is the format or why their formatting may not be working.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update "teaching assistant" in Glossary of User Guide
commitResults.messageBody:
"teaching assistant" in the Glossary should be capitalized, as
discussed in a review of the PR.

Let's capitalise "teaching assistant".

This way, we follow the standard notation used in many places worldwide
for "teaching assistant".
Update the validation regex and message constraint

The input and parameter names used in the diagram are incorrect.

Users may get confused with the conflicting diagram compared to
the actual implementation of the sequence.

Let's:
* Modify the input to display the correct format for the Delete
command.
* Modify the parameter names to match the ones used for
implementation.

Reusing the diagram is optimal here since most of it is correct.
There are only a few things that need to be changed.

commitResults.messageTitle: Change output message of Edit command
commitResults.messageBody:
The output message uses a colon to separate both the command word
and the updated properties.

This may not be such an intuitive output message.

Let's change the separator between the command word and the rest
of the message to "-".

This way, users can differentiate between the command word and
updated fields.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add skeleton code for Display command
commitResults.messageBody:
Added command to display a bar chart of all students' grades in
the current filtered list.

TAs may want to have a visualisation of their students' grades.
Combining this with find allows them to narrow down which
students' grades to display.

Let's add a trivial DisplayCommand to the parser.

We should ensure that the parsing of the command works first,
before proceeding with its implementation.

PS. Updated output of ListCommand to display "students" instead
of "persons", keeping to our intended product goal.

There is no way to visualise the grades of students.

It may be unintuitive for TAs when they want to have a sense of
the overall progress of their students.

Let's:
* Add a class for the Histogram behaviour
* Add a placeholder for the Histogram in the UI

A low score may not always indicate that a student is falling
behind, if everyone is also falling behind. A graph will allow
TAs to visualise who is truly falling behind.

PS. Work in progress

Added Person section and extracted important information into
coloured boxes.

Users may get confused when Person is used throughout the User
Guide without any clear definition for a Person.

Let's:
* Add a Person section
* Extract important information from our commands into coloured
boxes depending on the severity of the information.

This will help users understand what really comprises a Person
in our address book. The coloured boxes will also draw their
attention to the important details.

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge branch 'e-UserGuide-Billy' of https://github.com/Billy026/tp into e-UserGuide-Billy

commitResults.messageBody:
There were no charts to display for the Display command.

A working histogram chart was created to be displayed by the
command.

Let's
* Update the GUI for the histogram
* Allow the population of students' grades in the histogram

Now, TAs can visualise the grades of their students.

Histogram does not update when grades are changed or the displayed
list of students is changed.

Users will have to exit and reopen the program to see the changes
every time, which is very inconvenient.

Let's update Histogram to change with the displayed list of
students.

This way, the histogram can update as soon as changes are made,
allowing users to see the up-to-date histogram.

The y-axis label for Histogram has intervals of 0.1.

This is not useful as frequencies can only be integers. The
intervals should instead be 1.

Let's:
* Change the intervals of y-axis labels to be 1
* Set the maximum frequency to be displayed as 5, unless the data
has a higher frequency

This way, the y-axis has sensible intervals, and the bars are
of a suitable size.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix labels in x axis of Histogram
commitResults.messageBody:
The last label of the x axis is shown incorrectly, it shows "90-99"
instead of "90-100".

Users may be confused where grades of 100 will be categorized in
if no labels contain 100.

Let's update the last bin label to show "90-100".

This helps to clear misunderstandings with how the grade 100
is displayed in the Histogram.

Some test cases fail since our original format for Course is
different from our current format.

Since we restricted Course to only allow the NUS format for courses,
we should update our test cases to reflect this.

Let's update those test cases that failed to reflect our changes.

This ensures the functionality of our code is as we expected.

Some test cases were failing due to our new import/export command.

We should update our test cases to reflect these changes.

Let's update the relevant test cases.

This ensures all testing is up-to-date with our changes.

Some parts of the User Guide are ambiguous and confusing to users.

We should make our User Guide as clear and user-friendly as
possible, as users will refer to it to solve their problems.

Let's
* Explain some terms which may cause misunderstandings
* Standardize the format of the User Guide

This way, users can comfortably look through the User Guide for
solutions to their problem.

Special characters such as "/" and "." were not allowed in names.

Some names use these characters, and so these names would be
rejected.

Let's allow all characters in Name.

This way, not only will all symbols be allowed, but names in a
different language will also be allowed.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update Trim Spaces in Name bug
commitResults.messageBody:
Multiple consecutive spaces will be recorded as itself, instead
of being trimmed to a single space.

Names do not have more than a single space between characters.

Let's trim any extra spaces in the input name.

This avoids the extra effort a user needs to correct a student's
name if extra spaces are used.

commitResults.messageTitle: Revert "Update Trim Spaces in Name bug"
Reapply "Update Trim Spaces in Name bug"

commitResults.messageBody:
Some test cases no longer follow the relaxed restrictions on Name.

This will cause certain test cases to fail a positive case.

Let's modify these test cases to reflect the new restrictions on
Name.

This way, our test cases are up-to-date.

The phone validation regex does not capture other regular ways
phone numbers can be formatted.

These common formats should also be allowed for user-friendliness.

Let's
* Restrict the number of digits to be 7 to 15 digits long
* Allow an optional leading "+"
* Allow hyphens in between digits
* Reject consecutive hyphens

This will improve user-friendliness.

Some test cases do not account for the added formats for Phone.

This will cause certain test cases to fail a positive case.

Let's modify these test cases to reflect the new restrictions on
Phone.

This way, our test cases are up-to-date.

Course should be allowed to be case-insensitive.

Users should be able to enter Course as lowercase letters.

Let's:
* allow Course to be case-insensitive
* update the JavaDoc comments for Course

This enhances user-friendliness.

The test case should also test if Course is case-insensitive.

This accounts for the recent change to the validation regex, making
Courses case-insensitive.

Let's include an assert statement to check for case-insensitivity.

We should keep test cases up-to-date.

Import statements for some files are in the wrong lexicographical
order.

This leads to Checkstyle errors, preventing the project to build
correctly.

Let's arrange the import statements in the correct order.

This standardizes the coding formats between many developers.

Users could edit Grade for a student to be -1.

This is unintuitive, as we use -1 to signify NA in our UI.

Let's:
* Allow users to edit Grade to be NA
* Reject -1 as a Grade through the Edit command

NA will still be stored as -1 in Storage.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update test cases related to Grade
commitResults.messageBody:
Test cases that test -1 may now fail.

We should ensure tests for -1 and NA work as intended.

Let's update test cases regarding Grade to reflect the changes
made to Grade.

This way, our test cases will be up-to-date.

The AddCommand and EditCommand do not allow names with certain symbols,
with the error message showing a problem with the email. When an
invalid person is used in Edit Command, the incorrect error message is
shown.

Incorrect error messages will confuse the user about their problem.

Let's:
* change the default email
* add a message to PersonNotFoundException

We change the default email as it takes the name and appends
"@u.nus.edu" to it, which results in an invalid email format for
names with certain symbols, such as "/".

Some parts of the code do not match Checkstyle.

This causes the build to fail.

Let's fix problems with Checkstyle.

This standardizes the code format among developers.

Certain UI components do not fit correctly when the window size
is small, and there is no UI for notes.

This will diminish the appearance of the UI in such scenarios,
which may worsen user-experience.

Let's:
* Set minimum widths to the window size, Person panel and
Diagram panel
* Shorten the gap between Student details and their tutorial/lab
details
* Add GUI for Notes

This improves user-experience by making the GUI more appealing.

Some diagrams in the DG are outdated.

This may confuse the users.

Let's update the diagrams.

This makes the DG up-to-date.

The coloured box tests were not functioning properly.

This messed the format of the User Guide.

Let's remove blank lines in the HTML codes.

This will make the text display correctly.

User Guide does not have example images.

Users may not know the intended outcome of commands.

Let's add images to the User Guide.

This allows users to envision the output of their commands.

Added remaining pictures to the commands that did not have output
pictures.

This allows users to visualise the output of their command.

Let's add pictures showing the output of example commands.

This helps users know whether the output they got is correct.

Updated User Guide styling based on feedback from users.

This makes our User Guide more presentable to users, which may help
them when finding solutions for the problem they're facing.

Let's:
* Update images for Add, Edit and List command to be more concise
* Update several parts of our UG for small suggestions from the
feedback gathered
* Add a section for Graph Visualisation
* Reordered commands to match the summary of commands below

These changes standardize the styling of our UG, making it more
appealing to users.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix maximum frequency bug in Histogram
commitResults.messageBody:
The highest value on the yAxis of the Histogram does not update
when a grade range with frequency > 5 occurs.

This causes the histogram to show incomplete data when the highest
frequency is above 5.

Let's fix this bug.

This will allow users to correctly see the updated yAxis range.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update Person details column of PersonCard
commitResults.messageBody:
Long names cause the ID to be hidden by ellipses.

This can prevent users from viewing the id of that student, so they may
have to clear to remove them.

Let's set a minimum width for the Id field of the column.

This ensures the Id is always visible no matter the length of the name.

Sorting by name with SortCommand is case sensitive. i.e. it returns
"A", "Z", "a" in that order rather than "A", "a", "Z".

This may be illogical to users.

Let's make sorting by name case insensitive.

This way, names that are similar are grouped together regardless of
case sensitivity.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix file path bugs in FileCommand
commitResults.messageBody:
Users can use "." and "/" in file path, which may lead to file
navigability problems.

We should prevent this so that users cannot abuse the program to modify
their file directory in unintended ways.

Let's restrict the file path to alphanumeric characters and certain
symbols.

This also prevents any other symbol from possibly leading to an
unintended outcome.

We have not updated our code based on all the feedback.

We should incorporate as many relevant feedback as possible.

Let's update our code based on the feedback.

This accounts for all possible bugs.

The images are not consistent throughout and some inputs are keyboard
smashed characters.

This makes it not user-friendly to readers.

Let's replace all images with a consistent layout.

This will improve user-friendliness.

Some diagrams in the UG are incorrect.

This may lead readers to believe something that is incorrect.

Let's update these diagrams to the latest changes in our project.

This way all diagrams are up-to-date.

There is no template for the Implementation section.

Extracting these diagrams to their own section helps with the
design of the DG.

Let's:
* add a template for the Implementations section
* increase the width of some UML diagrams that were too small

This will help enhance the readability of the DG.
Fix DeleteSequence and Model class UML diagrams

commitResults.messageTitle: Update width of diagrams in DG
commitResults.messageBody:
Some diagrams are too small.

This will cause problems in the readability of the DG.

Let's increase the widths of the small diagrams.

This helps to improve readability
Update width of diagrams in DG

User Guide did not have page breaks.

This worsens the readability of the UG.

Let's add page breaks.

This improves the readability of the UG

Developer Guide did not have page breaks.

This worsens readability.

Let's include page breaks.

This improves readability

We do not have sample data.

This worsens code quality.

Let's add sample data.

This improves code quality.
Update README.md and product name in index.md

commitResults.messageBody:
The remark command will be rather useless
to the TAs due to the new notes functionality
that is planned.

Let's remove the remark functionaility to prevent
feature bloat.

Let's update DeleteCommand and the tests to work using
the person's ID instead of their index.

commitResults.messageTitle: Edit user guide specs and names
commitResults.messageBody:
The specs and name of the product have changed,
but the user guide has not.

It must be changed to be up-to-date.

Let's,
* update the delete command specs listed in the user guide
* change the name occurences from `AddressBook` to `BetterCallTA`
